prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: First of all, I really enjoy articles revolving around politics. I try to stay up to date on what's going on in the United States, as well as the US's relations to other countries. Outside of politics, I am interested in all things space related. I really enjoy hearing about new planets being discovered, as well as new advances in NASA technology. Third, I am a huge nature lover. Whenever a new species is discovered, or anything related to wildlife is researched, I like to know about it. This involves both land and sea creatures. Speaking of which, I am fascinated by creatures that live at the bottom of the ocean. I love to learn about what mysterious creatures leave deep under water. Next, I am a huge video game fan. My favorite system is the Xbox, but I enjoy all game systems. I like hearing about new video game developments as well as new system prospects. My favorite video game, by far, is Mortal Kombat. Finally, I am a big sports fan. I love professional soccer, MLB, and college basketball. The World Cup and March Madness are by far my favorite sporting events!

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I am interested in electric vehicles and their impact on climate change.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: While I am interested in political figures, kings and queens are more like celebrities to me (which I am not interested in).

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I enjoy reading about technology; I don't believe AI can be sentient, so I would like to read the argument saying that it can be.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I only read food articles if I intentionally seek one out; not ones that pop up randomly in a news feed

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I love National Geographic and am obsessed with the Amazon rainforest!

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Travel and Leisure
Title: These Airlines Have the Most Luxurious Economy Seats
Description: You can find good Champagne, amenity kits, hot towel service, and wider seats in the economy cabin — if you know where to look.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I don't take flights often at all, thus this article really isn't relevant to me.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Popular Science
Title: The right amount of online scrolling could decrease your risk of dementia
Description: A new demographic survey indicates a potential link between regular internet usage and cognitive health in older populations.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I enjoy science and technology articles, and this article seems like a perfect blending between the two.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Rolling Stone
Title: All of Nintendo’s Zelda Games, Ranked
Description: From NES to Switch, our picks for the best legends in the 35-year-old iconic adventure saga.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I absolutely love video games, especially the Legend of Zelda franchise! I have played them all, so I would love to see how the pros rank these games.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Sports Illustrated
Title: 2024 NFL Draft: The Six Players Fans Need to Know, Including Caleb Williams
Description: Quarterbacks will dominate the top 10, but the son of a former Hall of Fame receiver will be picked in the top five, too, along with another dominant Alabama defensive player.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I do watch football from time to time, but typically only games between my state teams, as well as championship games. I am not really too interested in players/games outside of that.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Architectural Digest
Title: Hang On, Is Artificial Grass Actually Chic?
Description: Designers discuss why faux lawns are more popular than you think.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I enjoy nature articles, but this feels more like a home improvement article versus a nature one.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Esquire
Title:The Best Summer Songs of 2023
Description: A sunny mix of 10 hits to carry you through the season.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I am not interested in this type of music.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Sunset Magazine
Title: 31 Perfect Recipes for Mother’s Day Brunch.
Description:Make mom’s day extra-special with an elegant homemade brunch. We’ve got your menu covered, from mains to drinks to dessert.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I only read food articles if I am looking for something specific.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Vogue
Title: 40 Minimalist Earrings to Wear Now and Forever
Description: From classic hoops to sculptural drops, these are the earrings you’ll never want to take off.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I am not interested in jewelry in any way, shape, or form.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Runner's World
Title: How to Prevent Running Injuries Before They Sideline You
Description: All the tips you need to keep running strong, including strength and mobility moves.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: While I do run a few times a month, this is not an article I would seek out.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Forbes
Title: Killing It
Description: How Two Failed Entrepreneurs Suddenly Began Making Millions Selling Murder Mysteries
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I am not particularly interested in business related articles.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Tricycle: The Buddhist Review
Title: Why We Look for Happiness in the Wrong Places
Description: Meditation teacher Sharon Salzberg discusses how our yearning for happiness can support us in our journey toward freedom—and why we tend to search for it in the wrong places.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I am not interested in spiritual wellness.

feedback.feedback_other:
Question 1 clarification: I felt what I wrote was very accurate and descriptive about what I enjoy, but the links provided by the AI were rather poor. There wee a couple that I thought were acceptable, but a large portion of them were completely unrelated to anything I wrote. 

Question 2 clarification: The description I wrote in part 1 was in my mind when answering "yes" or "no" to the articles provided. The ones I answered "yes" to, I thought at least in some part could be linked back to my description, whereas the ones I answered "no" to could not.

Question 3 clarification: I have used ChatGPT a few times simply out of curiosity, but for nothing more.
